title: Environmental Media Type Vocabulary
description: Controlled vocabulary for environmental media into which emissions, discharges, or monitoring measurements apply.

terms.label: Air
terms.definition: The atmospheric medium including ambient outdoor air and emissions released directly to the atmosphere.

terms.label: Surface Water
terms.definition: Rivers, lakes, wetlands, and other above-ground water bodies receiving discharges or monitoring observations.

terms.label: Groundwater
terms.definition: Subsurface water including aquifers and wells subject to contamination, discharge, or monitoring.

terms.label: Soil
terms.definition: Soil and surficial materials relevant to contamination, remediation, or land-based releases.

terms.label: Sediment
terms.definition: Deposited particulate material in surface waters that may accumulate pollutants or be subjected to sampling.

terms.label: Biota
terms.definition: Plants, animals, or microorganisms sampled or monitored for bioaccumulated contaminants or ecological impacts.

terms.label: Other Medium
terms.definition: An environmental medium that does not fit another, more specific category in this vocabulary.
